_header: They been not well for to leven
Note:
Walther (1963)
XWalther, Hans. Proverbia sententiaque latinitatis medii aevi. 6 vols. Göttingen, 1963-69, no. 17281.
_description: On the pitfalls of praise — two couplets in John Grimestone’s sermon notebook translating ‘Non bene creduntur si multa loquatur…’ or ‘Non bene creduntur nimium qui blanda locuntur…’ which precedes it

NLS18721.Transcription:
Þei ben nouth wel for to leuenþat with manie wordis wil
                    quemenfor often deceyued þe briddes bewith sundri songes &
                    loueli gle
